alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL CARROLL, NORTHWESTERN GRANT, NORTHWESTERN OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Kentucky Speedway, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Warsaw, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Sanders, Sparta, Munk, Stewartsville, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Wheatley, Eagle Hill, New Liberty, Napoleon, Twin Bridges, Holbrook, Sherman, Elliston and Carson. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 53 and 65. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 156 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
